content: What does 'stopped working' mean? Is it not loading? Is it giving any error messages? Can you not access emails already in TB? Can it connect to the email server? Please explain what TB isn't doing.
creator: frisée

content:
Thunderbird isn't an email account but a piece of software used to manage an account. To change your username, you would need to contact your Email provider. There may also be a setting in 'dodgyname@gmail.com' that will forward all your email to another Email account - in which case you would need to make another Gmail account and, eventually, get TB to access this account for email retrieval.

Or why not delete 'dodgyname@gmail.com' and make a single new Gmail account?
creator: frisée

content: When you say 'quit working', what does that actually mean? Does it fail to load? Please send screenshots of any error messages you are getting. Was TB working (downloading email etc.,) when your computer suffered a Communications outage?
creator: frisée

content: I cannot definitively provide you with a solution. I have often had this error and have waited for my ISP to get their act together as it has always been a problem with the SMTP server. Have you contacted your Email Provider or ISP? However, I've accessed your error message by searching in the window at the top left of this screen and note that many have advised that there could be a change in any Third Party anti-virus software that's being used.

content: I trust that this has resolved itself? My guess is that this doesn't have anything to do with TB but with the connections between you and the server that you're trying to access.

content:
If you have kept your emails synced on your Email Server then TB should download them when you establish a new IMAP account.

If you had moved the emails to Local Folders and removed them from the Email Server then it's unlikely that they will able to be recovered.
creator: frisée

content: What error messages are you getting?
creator: frisée

content: I'm not sure what you think is wrong. Compacting occurs across all the folders in TB, not just Trash and Junk. When an email is moved from one folder to another, it leaves behind blank space that cumulatively adds up. Compacting removes all this 'space'. If you click on the 3 dots to the right of +New Message and select 'Show Folder Size', you will be able to see the size of each data file relating to the folder. As you move files away from these, the size doesn't reduce because it crates 'blank space'. Compacting removes this.
creator: frisée

content: frisée, thanks for your response. It is possible that I don't really understand the situation, but this is totally different that TB has acted for me in the past. Whenever I have emptied the Trash it has always taken a few moments to accomplish that. Then when I select Compact, it will take a few moments and show me the space recovered. Then when I go to the In Box and select Compact it takes a long time to work its way through my large file. So the recent behavior of instant emptying of Trash and no compaction, but getting compaction from my small Junk folder, does not make sense to me. Thanks.
creator: russg2

content:
I advised you about how to show the space being used on your HD by each of the folders. If you do this, you will see how much space is being used and whether it seems to be disproportionate to the emails contained.

If the space is not shown, it's 'zero'.

If you then compact a folder, you would see a size reduction *if* there is blank space to remove.

Perhaps make some blank space in one of the suspect folders and then see what happens when you compact it?

creator: gfbartlett806

content:
You do realize that the Thunderbird email client is 100% free to download, install and use? as you can even download the source and build it yourself as some Linux users may do.

Mozilla does not even have any form of free one on one direct support by phone, chat, email, ticket etc for their main Firefox web browser products. It would require a lot of resources and call centre places to provide such support even if only in North America and not globally. It is generally the paid for or subscription based applications (like some antivirus clients as an example) that may have some form of direct one on one support because you got that as part of paying for it.

Mozilla did short experiments with third-party direct support for desktop Firefox in the early days by email and by phone though they were paid for and not free

However Mozilla does have direct ticket support for their subscription based products like Mozilla VPN and the premium/plus versions of Firefox Relay, Mozilla Monitor, Pocket, MDN Plus as you get such support as part of the subscription.
creator: James

All I can suggest is that:

1. You back up all your profiles. C:\Users\[Users]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\XXXX.default-release

2. You re-install the same version WITHOUT UNINSTALLING to see if it might overwrite a corrupted line of code. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/releases/

Please respond to this - even if you don't want to do this - so that your email re-enters the list of questions that need answering.

creator: kawczynski.insidepark

content:
In future, make back ups weekly. It saves a lot of heartache when systems crash.

In Windows, your profiles and data files are at C:\Users\[Users]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\XXXX.default-release

For TB to have kept an old copy of your files, it would need to have been made in 'Profiles' (there is a .default' folder but this isn't a previous Profile). My guess is that there might be a third folder in here with your old data.

If it's not, please reply to this and your email will go back in the queue for someone else to look at.

content:
This is a help file that was put together for use with people having problems sending emails. There is a link to a file for receiving them: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages That will give you some items to check.

My own - limited - experience with Server Timeouts is that they generally resolve themselves and that the problem is with the server rather than the Email program being used.

Please respond to this message if you cannot resolve it and it will get pushed back into the queue of questions to be dealt with.

.oOo.

Dies ist eine Hilfedatei, die für Benutzer zusammengestellt wurde, die Probleme beim Senden von E-Mails haben. Es gibt einen Link zu einer Datei zum Empfangen von E-Mails: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages Dort finden Sie einige Punkte, die Sie überprüfen sollten.

Meine eigene – begrenzte – Erfahrung mit Server-Timeouts ist, dass sie sich im Allgemeinen von selbst lösen und dass das Problem eher beim Server als beim verwendeten E-Mail-Programm liegt.

Bitte antworten Sie auf diese Nachricht, wenn Sie das Problem nicht lösen können. Sie wird dann wieder in die Warteschlange der zu bearbeitenden Fragen verschoben.

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

content:
I used to get this when my ISP was blacklisted by some Mail Providers. It appeared that someone was sending out large amounts of Spam through the Email Provider and we all got blocked.

You could start by contacting the recipient to see if there's something they can do with their Email provider. You could also reboot your PC to obtain a new IP address for your connection.

You could also look at your email to see if there is anything in it that might be identified as spam. Such as the use of many recipients under Bcc and Cc fields (I presently get emails rejected if I Bcc too many people).

content:
I share your frustration and I have complained since 2022 when threading became the default. Have you changed the default in config editor? That's the best defense we have.

To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags 0 =unthreaded

Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right. 

 ------------

FOR EXISTING FOLDERS These steps may help: To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: This must be done on an account by account basis.

  1. select table view - the icon just to right of 'quick filter' button above message list pane
  2. select a message folder and apply all desired attributes - View>sort by from menu bar (if not shown, click alt key)
  3. click the icon at right side of column display in message list pane
  4. select the entry near bottom 'Apply current view to...'
  5. highlight 'folder and children'
  6. move mouse left to see account name and move left again to display all account folders. Now CLICK. a small menu will appear to confirm setting all folders within that account.
